Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: googleClientId
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Gmail accounts, you must enable the Gmail API in your Google API Console and obtain a Client ID for your app’s bundle.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: outlookClientId
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: In order to authenticate Outlook accounts, you must register your app at the Azure Portal (https://portal.azure.com/) and add a new App Registration. This will generate an Application (client) ID

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: userHasProvider
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Whether there is a stored provider

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: currentProvider
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If there is a stored provider, this property will indicate which provider it is

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: dayCutoff
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: How far back (in days) to search the user’s inbox for e-receipts

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: dateCutoff
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: This property is an alternative to dayCutoff which allows you to set a specific date/time that serves as the boundary of how far back to search.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: searchUntilDate
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: This property works in tandem with dateCutoff and allows you to set the later boundary (i.e. until when) for the search period

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: userCurrentEmail
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If the OAuth provider supports returning the logged-in email, it will be populated into this property after OAuth or silent authentications

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: senderWhitelist
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: If populated, the keys in this dictionary will be used as the senders to search the user’s inbox for, and the corresponding values will be used as the merchant sender address for parsing purposes

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: aggregateResults
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Controls whether or not to aggregate all emails relating to a given e-receipt order (such as shipping status updates) in the results structure

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: +shared
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: <hr>

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -beginOAuthForProvider:withViewController:andCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Begins the OAuth process for the given provider (currently only Gmail and Outlook supported). If the completion is called with no error, you may then invoke -[BREReceiptManager getEReceiptsWithCompletion:]

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -storeImapCredentials:andPassword:forProvider:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: For IMAP providers (AOL, Yahoo, Gmail if you prefer to connect to Gmail via IMAP, or a custom IMAP provider) you must store the credentials prior to calling -[BREReceiptManager getEReceiptsWithCompletion:]

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -setCustomIMAPHost:port:useTLS:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: For custom IMAP providers, you must call this method to supply basic information about how to connect to this provider before you call storeImapCredentials:andPassword:forProvider:

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -setupIMAPForProvider:viewController:withCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: To connect to Gmail, Yahoo, or AOL accounts via IMAP, the user will have to enable certain account settings. Call this function to start the process

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -verifyImapCredentials:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Verifies that stored IMAP credentials are valid

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -getEReceiptsWithCompletion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Attempts to retrieve new (since last check) e-receipts from the stored e-mail account. You must have successfully authenticated an OAuth provider, or stored IMAP credentials (and setup IMAP if necessary) prior to calling this method

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -parseEReceiptFromSender:rawHTML:completion:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: For debugging the parsing of e-receipt HTML

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -signOut
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Signs out of any stored email account and stored e-receipt info. For OAuth providers this signs out of the provider and invalidates the access token. For IMAP providers this removes stored credentails.

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -resetEmailsChecked
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Resets emails so you don’t need to log out and log in during testing

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.name: -openURL:options:provider:
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: A passthrough function to be used in your app delegate’s openURL:options:provider: method

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: dayCutoff
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Set this property to control how far back in the user’s history to search for orders

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: dateCutoff
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: This property is an alternative to dayCutoff which allows you to set a specific date/time that serves as the boundary of how far back to search.

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: countryCode
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Set this to a different country to access the correct version of the retailer’s site, if it exists for that country (currently only supports Amazon UK)

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -getLinkedRetailers
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Returns all retailers for which there is a linked account

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -resetHistory
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Resets order history for all linked accounts

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.name: -grabNewOrdersWithCompletion:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html#/c:.abstract: Grab new orders across all linked accounts

Classes/BRAccountLinkingCredentials.html.name: +nameForRetailer:
Classes/BRAccountLinkingCredentials.html.abstract: Retrieves a friendly name for a given retailer

Classes/BRAccountLinkingCredentials.html.name: BRAccountLinkingCredentials
Classes/BRAccountLinkingCredentials.html.abstract: Instantiate a BRAccountLinkingCredentials object after collecting the credentials for a given retailer from the user

Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html.name: BRAccountLinkingManager
Classes/BRAccountLinkingManager.html.abstract: Use this interface to manage users’ linked retailer accounts for parsing e-receipts. Here is the basic flow:

Classes/BREReceiptManager.html.name: BREReceiptManager
Classes/BREReceiptManager.html.abstract: This class is the interface to manage e-receipt parsing
